title: HTTP Host injection in redirect_to function
vulnerability_information: Hi team, Here is the sample vulnerable code ```ruby class TesttestController < ApplicationController def index redirect_to "/demo/?your_reset_token=your_reset_token" end end ``` The ** _compute_redirect_to_location** will take the input **"/demo/?your_reset_token=your_reset_token"** as **options** variables. File **File **action_controller\metal\redirecting.rb**** line 63 ```ruby def redirect_to(options = {}, response_options = {}) raise ActionControllerError.new("Cannot redirect to nil!") unless options raise AbstractController::DoubleRenderError if response_body self.status = _extract_redirect_to_status(options, response_options) self.location = _compute_redirect_to_location(request, options) self.response_body = "You are being redirected." end ``` Then it will check if the **options**, because the input is **String**, so it will be the concatenate of **request.protocol + request.host_with_port + options** File **action_controller\metal\redirecting.rb** line 96 ```ruby def _compute_redirect_to_location(request, options) #:nodoc: case options # The scheme name consist of a letter followed by any combination of # letters, digits, and the plus ("+"), period ("."), or hyphen ("-") # characters; and is terminated by a colon (":"). # See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3.1 # The protocol relative scheme starts with a double slash "//". when /\A([a-z][a-z\d\-+\.]*:|\/\/).*/i options when String request.protocol + request.host_with_port + options when Proc _compute_redirect_to_location request, instance_eval(&options) else url_for(options) end.delete("\0\r\n") end module_function :_compute_redirect_to_location public :_compute_redirect_to_location ``` The **request.protocol** will be **http://** or **https://** The **request.host_with_port** will call **raw_host_with_port** to check if there is the **X_FORWARD_FOR** else, it will take the input from **HTTP_HOST** then continue the **_compute_redirect_to_location** process. file **action_dispatch\http\url.rb** line 220 ```ruby def raw_host_with_port if forwarded = x_forwarded_host.presence forwarded.split(/,\s?/).last else get_header("HTTP_HOST") || "#{server_name || server_addr}:#{get_header('SERVER_PORT')}" end end ``` So at the end, our input will be **request.protocol + request.host_with_port + options** and being set as **Header["location"]** value. We cant change the HTTP_HOST to something else because the HTTP_HOST must be declare in the the **config.host** and raise 403 Status ( see the **img4.JPG** ) But if we use the IP, we can bypass this and here is the result, which 149.28.128.52 is the attacker IP, and there is no check for IP address but only the hostname. The **img2.JPG** is the PoC request when use HTTP_HOST. The **img3.JPG** is the PoC request when use HTTP_X_FORWARD_HOST. Fix: There should be a check for IP ADDRESS as well as the HOSTNAME in the enviroment config if user dont specific the host as parameter for **redirect_to** function. ## Impact Password Reset Poisoning - which user use the HTTP_HOST as the input for the reset token. Web-cache - which user use the HTTP_HOST as the input

weakness.name: Improper Neutralization of HTTP Headers for Scripting Syntax

activities.message:
Hi @komang4130,

Thank you for your submission. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Kind regards,
@princeofpersia

Hello @komang4130,

This is intended behavior if you look at the function documentation [Here](https://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActionController/Redirecting.html), you will notice that there's a second parameter,  `allow_other_host` which can be used to prevent the redirection to another host by setting it to `false`, by default it's set to `true`.

Regards,
@princeofpersia

Hi, 

So i change my code as the Docs describe, and the issue still happen, can you review it again please?
```ruby
class TesttestController < ApplicationController
  def index
    redirect_back fallback_location: '/demo/?your_reset_token=your_reset_token', allow_other_host: false
  end
end
```

PoC image: **img5.JPG**

The fallback location and allow_other_host = true are just to prevent the **hostname** from url
And at the end of the day, it still call the **redirect_to** which vulnerable as i describe.

Flow code as image: **img6.JPG**

The **fallback_location** and **allow_other_host = false** are just to prevent the hostname from the Referer header You can see the code here: file **action_controller\metal\redirecting.rb**
```ruby
def redirect_back(fallback_location:, allow_other_host: true, **args)
      referer = request.headers["Referer"]
      redirect_to_referer = referer && (allow_other_host || _url_host_allowed?(referer))
      redirect_to redirect_to_referer ? referer : fallback_location, **args
    end
```

And if the hostname is not specific, the flow of **redirect_to** will take input in HTTP_HOST or HTTP_X_FORWARD_FOR as i describe at the beginning.

Please check it. @princeofpersia

Hello @komang4130,

The code you provided the developer is intentionally send the token to a URL, since the host header can only be changed using a proxy or similar tool, I believe this is not an issue.

```
class TesttestController < ApplicationController
  def index
    redirect_to  "/demo/?your_reset_token=your_reset_token"
  end
end
```

Regards,
@princeofpersia

Hi, 

My code is just an example of host header injection like this
https://hackerone.com/reports/226659

Sorry for not being clear.

I will give u more detail and sample app tmr.

https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/29893

Here is already a report about this problem, but they fixed by using config.hosts.

But this one i can bypass this by using IP Address.
I wonder why you are not consider it as the Security while other your collegue consider it as the HOST HEADER INJECTION?

My vuln can be explained in the article below
https://www.acunetix.com/blog/articles/automated-detection-of-host-header-attacks/

I can use IP Instead of using hostname which is whitelisted by the config.hosts in the github issue i have given to you above.

Hi ,

I've attach sample code project  **sample.zip** based on **https://guides.rubyonrails.org/getting_started.html**

But what if i change the HTTP_HOST by using IP address or use the HTTP_X_FORWARED_HOST, it will redirect to the IP i want.

So here is the flow of the **show** function, receive id  from parameter -> response the data , if any error happen, redirect to the **root_path**, it is Developer intentional. ( file **app\controllers\articles_controller.rb** line **11** )

But if i change the host to another IP address, it will redirect to the IP Address host, this is NOT the Developer intentional.

normal request **show_request1.JPG**
fake host request **fake_host_show.JPG**
fake host request with X-Forwarded-Host **fake_x_forwarded_host_show.JPG**

The POST request has the protection to verify the **authenticity_token** by checking if Header["Origin"] and the **allow_other_host = false** from **redirect_back** by checking Header["Referer"] 
But if we remove both of them, we still can get the redirect. ( file **app\controllers\articles_controller.rb** line **23** )

normal fake host create request is prohibited  **normal_create_request.JPG**
fake host request by removing origin and referrer**fake_host_create_request.JPG**
fake host request with X-Forwarded-Host by removing origin and referrer **fake_x_forwarded_host_create_request.JPG**
